name: Guacamole-Style Quinoa
author: Mom2Bell&Bubba
summary: My husband and I are following the guidelines of the Virgin Diet (no gluten, soy, eggs, dairy, peanuts, corn, or sugar) and wanted to experiment with some new ways to eat quinoa. We love guacamole, and decided to transfer the ingredients into this healthy and flavorful quinoa dish.
ingredients: 2 cloves garlic, minced, or more to taste
1 ¾ cups chicken stock, or as needed
directions: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir onion and garlic in the hot oil until slightly browned, about 5 minutes
Stir quinoa into onion mixture and cook until quinoa is lightly browned, about 30 seconds
Squeeze lime juice into a 2-cup measuring cup; pour in enough chicken stock to make 2 cups liquid
Pour chicken stock mixture over quinoa and bring to a boil
Reduce heat, cover saucepan, and simmer until liquid is absorbed and quinoa is tender, about 15 minutes
Remove saucepan from heat and chill in the refrigerator, about 1 hour
Fold cilantro, tomatoes, avocado, and jalapeno pepper into quinoa mixture
Return quinoa to refrigerator for flavors to blend or serve immediately
